problem.claim_text: Show that f(n) is O(g(n)) by giving explicit constants.
problem.domain_text: Assume n is a natural number with n ≥ 1.

blocks.text: Convert the lower bound on n into a real-number inequality.
Use n at least 1 to compare n with n squared.
Use n at least 1 to show n squared is at least 1.
Bound the linear term by a multiple of n squared.
Bound the constant term by a multiple of n squared.
Combine the term bounds to get an overall quadratic bound with a single coefficient.
blocks.lean: have hsum : f n ≤ (57:ℝ) * ((n:ℝ)^2) := by dsimp [f]; nlinarith [h12, h40]

blocks.text: Increase the coefficient to match the chosen constant c.
Rewrite g(n) directly as n squared.
blocks.lean: have hg : g n = ((n:ℝ)^2) := by rfl

blocks.text: Note that adding 1 makes a quantity larger.
Chain the two inequalities to reach the final bound.
